properties.name: 1240 W. Main
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThe old building that housed Jeff, Tracy, Albert, Tommy and Kelley, Chas and me for some time. Great seats for watching idiots driving too quickly down Ridge Pike and smashing into other cars stopped at the light.

properties.name: 1401 Butcher Dr.
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass Mom\'s old place. I lived here before I moved to Austin.

properties.name: 2804 Colony Dr.
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass  This was the Audubon address. This is where I played with GI Joe, Transformers and He-Man toys. Good times.

properties.name: 354 Apple St.
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass354 Apple St., Pottstown, PAI didn\'t like Pottstown very much. This is where we lived, then.

properties.name: 4903 Gladeview
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassMy first place in Austin. It burned on Dec. 10, 2003 thanks (no thanks) to evil squirrels nibbling on wires in the walls. (Again, thanks or no thanks to the landlord for dealing with them after all the complaints I made.)

properties.name: A bit of the ocean
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass Here\'s a small bit of ocean. I don\'t know much about it because I\'ve never been there. At least, I don\'t think that I have. There might be some sort of secret island hideaway of some super villain. There might be nothing. There might a fish or two floating around in this area. I don\'t know. I guess it\'s a safe bet to say that it\'s probably warmer in this area for most of the year. Again, I\'m no expert on this matter. Mayhaps, one day, I will sail across this little stitch of water and find the answers to all these questions.

properties.name: Aljohn's
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassWhere we had our first date.

properties.name: Betty Lane
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassI like this place.

properties.name: Bridgeport Towers
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass My first apartment. I believe it was G-4. The neighbors were awesome! The bouncing bunny guy wore bunny slippers and radio headphones - he bounced his way to the mailbox. There was an crotchety dude who cruised around in one of those motorized chairs. He hated all my friends but like me. When he spoke, he did it in rhyme. The creepy mumbler waited under the awning near the back entrance for his mother.

properties.name: Camp Geiger
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybasscamp geiger, north carolinaMore training fun with Uncle Sam. Thanks for screwing up my knee.

properties.name: Camp Hansen
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybasskinThis is where I got my mail in Okinawa! Weeeeeeeeeee!

properties.name: Camp Pendleton
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassCamp Pendleton, CAWhat a blast it was to live in CA ... on a Marine base. I\'m glad I left.

properties.name: Central Market (South)
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass We play here from time to time.

properties.name: Cheyenne, WY
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassI lived here with Chas and her mom and brothers for a little while. I certainly didn\'t do much.

properties.name: Elephant Room
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass315 Congress, Austin, TX 78701This is where I play every Wednesday evening with The Jazz Pharaohs.

properties.name: Flipnotics CoffeeSpace
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThis is where I play very regularly - just about every Tuesday night. I\'ve played there since 2000 at least once a week, barring vacations and tours and whatnot - sometimes, two, three and four times a week. This is where Lauryn and I met - officially. Hooray Mark and Marty! And, thanks!

properties.name: Gino's Italian Grill
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassI play here with Erik Hokkanen a bunch. It\'s a weird hole-in-the-wall but somehow, it manages some endearing quality.

properties.name: Grandmom and Grandpop Gould's
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass750 Kohn St, Norristown, PAToo many great memories of this place thanks to Grandmom and Grandpop! Right next store, at 750 1/2 was where I spent my first three years.

properties.name: My first day on the job ...
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassHere\'s where the world saw my face for the first time.

properties.name: Nice wreck
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassCamp Lejeune, NCSomewhere along this highway in San Antonio, just as we were getting into town, an 18-wheeler nearly decapitated us, sent Craig\'s car down the road - backwards at 55 mph in the middle of lunch time traffic. Craig\'s incredible coolness under pressure saved us from any injury whatsoever. After we wheeled what was left of the car off to the side of the road, Craig went to check on the tractor trailer driver. The guy threw his arms up in the air, yelling, "Didn\'t you hear me honking my horn!?" The radio was off in the car, none of us were speaking. (We were probably all thinking about Alex - I know I was.) All I heard was that trailer digging into the side of the car.

properties.name: Oak Place
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass#215 This was a great apartment. It was a tiny, one bedroom but all I needed! Erica was to the right, Roy was to the left, Ron was to Roy\'s left and Benjamin was below me. Erik lived two buildings down in #106. The rent was affordable and I was only a block away from the pool! The neighbors were great! We looked out for each other and hung out on the patio for conversation all the time. What a great neighborhood! But, some rich idiot bought up the place and kicked us all out to turn the place into condos - 560 sq ft, one bedroom places to be sold from 9,000 to 29,000. ... grumble, grumble ...

properties.name: Our Place
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass Under the noisy, heavy-walking neighbors

properties.name: Our Tree
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass  This is where we watch owls attack each other. Sometimes, we play bocce here.

properties.name: PMS
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThis is where I met so many interesting students! Great.

properties.name: Parris Island
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThis is where I began my recruit training to become a U.S. Marine. Fun!

properties.name: Pato's Tacos
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassWe met here once a week under the organization we called Uncle Smithee\'s Esoteric Music Emancipators - a good idea that wandered off on its own somewhere. We played some here, too.

properties.name: Pottstown Senior High
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThis illustrious academic fortress granted me a diploma.

properties.name: Ross' Old Austin Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass 11800 N. Lamar Blvd., Austin, Texas, 78753This is one of my favorite places to play. Ross and Steven host us once a month. They are the kindest hosts! The food is great!

properties.name: Satellite Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass 7101 W Hwy 71, Ste E1 Austin, TX 78735This another great place hosted by Mark and Marty K. of Flip\'s fame. We play in here from time to time and it\'s always a pleasure. And, the food is always good!

properties.name: School of Music
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass  This is where Lauryn teaches music. I visit there sometimes. I like her. I think she is a good teacher.

properties.name: Stacy Pool
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass austin, texasThis is the pool where we swim every day. Specifically, the arrows is pointing to the bench on which our dry clothes wait for us until we\'re done. This is one of my favorite places in Austin. I miss John Sayyid.

properties.name: The Black Cat
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass309 E. Sixth Street. Austin, TX 78701OR, it used to be the Black Cat. This was the only place on 6th St. worth visiting. Certainly, the only place worth playing. I\'m sad it\'s gone.

properties.name: The Continental Club
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass Here is the ever popular Continental Club. Steve hosts plenty of great music here every night. I play here occassionally - these days, with Erik, Whit Smith or Paris 49.

properties.name: The Elephant Room
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThis is where I play just about every Wednesday with the Pharaohs. It smells bad but it\'s a friendly place and I like being there - at least, for the two hours I\'m there.

properties.name: The Shallow End of Barton Springs
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass This is where the weak enter the Springs. This is where I entered the Springs like an idiot and slipped on the fungal floor or the Springs. My toe slipped into one of the cracks in the surface and !snap! broken toe for me! Delightful!

properties.name: The Tree House
properties.description: Posted by Giantcitybass The Jazz Babies play here a couple times a month. Fred is the owner and he is a nice guy. He cares about music. The food is great!

properties.name: University Heights
properties.description: Posted by GiantcitybassThis was the miserable fratty-town where I lived for a year after Oak Place gave me the boot. It might have been a nice place to live if I liked to hang out with a bunch of college kids who had no idea of how to be responsible or a horrible parent who didn\'t care about raising children. Glad I moved.
